member.name: T:Rti.Config.Logger
member.summary: The singleton used to configure RTI Connext logging

member.name: P:Rti.Config.Logger.Instance
member.summary: Get the singleton Logger instance

member.name: E:Rti.Config.Logger.MessageLogged
member.summary: Event triggered whenever RTI Connext logs a message.

remarks.para: This event allows a custom redirection or processing of RTI Connext log messages.
If this event is handled, log messages will no longer be directed to the Console. After all handlers are removed, log messages will be directed to the Console again.
For a code example, see \ref DDSConfigurationExampleModule_logging.

member.name: T:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol
member.summary: QoS related to the reliable writer protocol defined in RTPS.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.LowWatermark
member.summary: When the number of unacknowledged samples in the current send window of a reliable writer meets or falls below this threshold, the is considered to have changed.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.HighWatermark
member.summary: When the number of unacknowledged samples in the current send window of a reliable writer meets or exceeds this threshold, the is considered to have changed.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.HeartbeatPeriod
member.summary: The period at which to send heartbeats.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.FastHeartbeatPeriod
member.summary: An alternative heartbeat period used when a reliable writer needs to flush its unacknowledged samples more quickly.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.LateJoinerHeartbeatPeriod
member.summary: An alternative heartbeat period used when a reliable reader joins late and needs to be caught up on cached samples of a reliable writer more quickly than the normal heartbeat rate.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.VirtualHeartbeatPeriod
member.summary: The period at which to send virtual heartbeats. Virtual heartbeats inform the reliable reader about the range of samples currently present, for each virtual GUID, in the reliable writer's queue.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.SamplesPerVirtualHeartbeat
member.summary: The number of samples that a reliable writer has to publish before sending a virtual heartbeat.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.MaxHeartbeatRetries
member.summary: The maximum number of \em periodic heartbeat retries before marking a remote reader as inactive.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.InactivateNonprogressingReaders
member.summary: Whether to treat remote readers as inactive when their NACKs do not progress

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.HeartbeatsPerMaxSamples
member.summary: The number of heartbeats per current send window.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.MinNackResponseDelay
member.summary: The minimum delay to respond to a NACK.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.MaxNackResponseDelay
member.summary: The maximum delay to respond to a nack.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.NackSuppressionDuration
member.summary: The duration for ignoring consecutive NACKs that may trigger redundant repairs.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.MaxBytesPerNackResponse
member.summary: The maximum total message size when resending rejected samples.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.DisablePositiveAcksMinSampleKeepDuration
member.summary: The minimum duration a sample is queued for ACK-disabled readers.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.DisablePositiveAcksMaxSampleKeepDuration
member.summary: The maximum duration a sample is queued for ACK-disabled readers.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.DisablePositiveAcksSampleMinSeparation
member.summary: The minimum duration a sample is queued for ACK-disabled readers.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.DisablePositiveAcksEnableAdaptiveSampleKeepDuration
member.summary: Enables dynamic adjustment of sample keep duration in response to congestion.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.DisablePositiveAcksEnableSpinWait
member.summary: Enables spinning when write is blocked.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.DisablePositiveAcksDecreaseSampleKeepDurationFactor
member.summary: Controls rate of contraction of dynamic sample keep duration.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.DisablePositiveAcksIncreaseSampleKeepDurationFactor
member.summary: Controls rate of growth of dynamic sample keep duration.

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.MinSendWindowSize
member.summary: Minimum size of send window of unacknowledged samples

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.MaxSendWindowSize
member.summary: Maximum size of send window of unacknowledged samples

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Core.Policy.RtpsReliableWriterProtocol.SendWindowUpdatePeriod

member.summary: When assigned this value, the publication priority of the data writer, or channel of a multi-channel data writer, will be set to the lowest possible value.

member.summary: When assigned this value, the publication priority of the data writer, or channel of a multi-channel data writer, will be set to the largest priority value of any sample currently queued for publication by the data writer or data writer channel.

member.name: T:Rti.Dds.Core.QosProvider
member.summary: Provides access to XML-defined QoS profiles, data types, and complete DDS systems.
member.remarks:
A QosProvider is created with a URI that identifies a resource from where to load the definition of: - QoS profiles - Type definitions - Full XML-defined DDS systems
The URI can be: - An XML file - A string representation of an XML document `str://"..."` - A group of several files and strings (see [URL Groups](https://community.rti.com/static/documentation/connext-dds/current/doc/manuals/connext_dds_professional/users_manual/index.htm#users_manual/URL_Groups.htm) in the User's Manual)
The following example loads a file named `"MyProfiles.xml"` in the current directory. Then it retrieves the `DataReaderQos` from a `<qos_profile>` named `"MyProfile"` under a `<qos_library>` named `"MyLibrary"` to create a `DataReader`:
\code var myQosProvider = new QosProvider("MyProfiles.xml"); var myReader = subscriber.CreateDataReader( myTopic, myQosProvider.GetDataReaderQos("MyLibrary::MyProfile")); \endcode
To load type definitions, see .
To create a and its contained entities, see .
@section SelectingQosProfile Selecting a QoS profile
The profile name argument is optional:
\code var readerQos = myQosProvider.GetDataReaderQos(); \endcode
When omitted, the QosProvider looks for a profile as follows (in order of precedence): - The profile set with - The profile set in the constructor (an optional argument) - The `<qos_profile>` identified as the default profile with the attribute `is_default_qos=true` - If none of the above methods have been used, a QoS object with the documented default values is returned
A QosProvider can be used in combination with functions such as or
to set the profile that entities are created with by default:
\code subscriber.DefaultDataReaderQos = myQosProvider.GetDataReaderQos("MyLibrary::MyProfile");
// reader created with the QoS in the profile "MyLibrary::MyProfile" var reader = subscriber.CreateDataReader(topic); \endcode
More information about QoS Profiles can be found in the [QoS Profiles section](https://community.rti.com/static/documentation/connext-dds/current/doc/manuals/connext_dds_professional/users_manual/index.htm#users_manual/QoS_Profiles.htm), in the User's Manual.
@section DefaultQosProvider The Default QosProvider
A special QosProvider, QosProvider.Default is always available to obtain the QoS profiles from the default locations, such as the file USER_QOS_PROFILES.xml in the current directory. For example, the following code obtains the default `DataReaderQos`:
\code var defaultReaderQos = QosProvider.Default.GetDatareaderQos(); \endcode
[This section](https://community.rti.com/static/documentation/connext-dds/current/doc/manuals/connext_dds_professional/users_manual/index.htm#users_manual/How_to_Load_XML_Specified_QoS_Settings.htm#xmlconfiguration_1275484337_316960%3FTocPath%3DPart%25203%253A%2520Advanced%2520Concepts%7C18.%2520Configuring%2520QoS%2520with%2520XML%7C18.5%2520How%2520to%2520Load%2520XML-Specified%2520QoS%2520Settings%7C_____0) in the User's Manual explains which profiles are automatically loaded by the default QosProvider.
The profiles that QosProvider.Default loads can be configured with . This method should be called before QosProvider.Default is accessed.
\code QosProvider.SetDefaultProviderParams(Profile.Default.With(p => { // Load MyProfiles.xml and disable USER_QOS_PROFILES.xml p.UrlProfile.Add("MyProfiles.xml"); p.IgnoreUserProfile = true; })); \endcode
QosProvider.Default also determines the default values for `<participant_factory_qos>`, which can be used to configure logging.
@section BuiltinProfiles Built-in QoS Profiles
Any QosProvider, including the default QosProvider, has access to the built-in profiles. For example, to obtain the `DataWriterQos` from the "strict reliable" built-in profile:
\code var strictReliableWriterQos = QosProvider.Default.GetDataWriterQos( "BuiltinQosLib::Generic.StrictReliable"); \endcode
@section TopicFilters Specifying a Topic Filter XML QoS definitions can specify a `topic_filter` attribute. Several functions (such as receive a `topicName` argument. When these functions look for the QoS, they will try to match the `topicName` against the `topic_filter`s, if they are used. See the [Topic Filters section](https://community.rti.com/static/documentation/connext-dds/current/doc/manuals/connext_dds_professional/users_manual/index.htm#users_manual/Topic_Filters.htm) in the User's Manual.
@see \ref DDSEntityExampleModule

member.summary: Allows an application to wait until one or more of the attached Condition objects have a trigger value of true or else until the timeout expires.

member.summary: Creates a new WaitSet with a non-default configuration.

member.summary: Retrieves the list of attached Conditions.

member.summary: Attaches a Condition to the WaitSet.

member.summary: Detaches a Condition from the WaitSet.

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Core.WaitSet.Dispatch(Omg.Dds.Core.Duration)
member.summary: Waits for at least one of the attached conditions to trigger and then calls the event handler for each of the active conditions.

remarks.para: This is an alternative pattern to the use of Wait(). Instead of receiving the list of active conditions, the application associates an event handler to each condition before attaching it to the WaitSet. When this method wakes up after one or more conditions have become active, it calls their event handlers before returning. The handlers are called by Dispatch() in the context of the current thread.

member.param: The maximum time to wait. If that time elapses this method returns normally without calling any of the condition handlers.
member.returns: The number of conditions that were triggered (or 0 if the maxWait elapsed)

member.name: T:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1
member.summary: Allows serializing and deserializing IDL types as byte buffers

remarks.para: @warning The ISerializer methods are not thread-safe. To use them in multiple threads, either protect them or create a different ISerializer per thread
This type is IDisposable, but it automatically calls Dispose() in its destructor.
This interface has **extension methods**, see \ref SerializerExtensions.

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.Serialize(`0)
member.summary: Serializes a data sample into a byte array
member.param: A data sample
member.returns: A new byte array containing the serialized data

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.Serialize(`0,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Serializes a data sample into a byte array
member.param: A data sample
A byte buffer with enough space to contain the serialized data

The available length of the byte buffer. This operation throws DdsException if the data doesn't fit. You can obtain the exact size required for this sample with or a size that is guaranteed to suffice for any sample of this type with .
member.returns: The actual number of bytes that were serialized

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.Deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes a data sample from a byte array
member.param: A byte array containing the serialized data
member.returns: A new data sample created by deserializing the buffer

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.Deserialize(System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deserializes a data sample from a byte buffer
member.param: A byte buffer containing the serialized data
The length of the byte buffer
member.returns: A new data sample created by deserializing the buffer

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.GetSerializedSampleMaxSize
member.summary: Calculates the maximum number of bytes that any data sample of type `T` may take in serialized form.

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.GetSerializedSampleMinSize
member.summary: Calculates the minimum number of bytes that any data sample of type `T` may take in serialized form.

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.GetSerializedSampleSize(`0)
member.summary: Calculates the exact number of bytes that a given data sample takes in serialized form.
member.param: The data sample
member.returns: The number of bytes that the sample needs to be serialized

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Topics.ISerializer`1.ToDynamicData(`0)
member.summary: Converts a T sample into a DynamicData sample.
member.param: The sample to convert
member.returns: A copy of sample as a DynamicData object

member.name: T:Rti.Dds.Subscription.LoanedSample`1
member.summary: Contains the data and the information associated with a sample, which are only valid until their container is Disposed
member.remarks: Any reference contained within a `LoanedSample` is only valid until the corresponding has been Disposed. Attempting to access any data within the sample after that is undefined behavior.
member.typeparam: The topic type of the data

member.name: P:Rti.Dds.Subscription.LoanedSample`1.Data
member.summary: Gets the data

member.summary: Gets the information about this sample

member.param: Output parameter assigned this.Data
Output parameter assigned this.Info

member.name: M:Rti.Dds.Subscription.LoanedSample`1.ToString
member.summary: Returns `Data.ToString()` when `Info.ValidData` is true; otherwise it returns a readable summary of the `Info`.

member.name: T:Rti.Dds.Subscription.LoanedSamples`1
member.summary: Provides temporary access to a collection of samples (data and info).

remarks.para: This collection needs to be **explicitly disposed** when it is no longer needed (typically with a `using` statement). The underlying middleware resources it uses will not be released by the garbage collector.
After disposing the collection, its elements and all their references are no longer valid and cannot be accessed. To keep the data around, you can copy it.

member.summary: Provides access to the samples

member.summary: Returns the number of samples

member.name: T:Rti.Dds.Subscription.SampleProcessor
member.summary: A SampleProcessor automatically takes the data from the attached readers and provides each data sample to a user-defined handler function. The SampleProcessor uses a configurable thread pool to wait for the data and call the handlers.
member.remarks: Readers cannot be disposed while they're attached to a SampleProcessor.

member.name: M:Rti.Types.Dynamic.DynamicData.SetValue``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sets value of type using the name of the member.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to retrieve. Supported types are: byte, short, ushort, int, uint, float, double, LongDouble, decimal, bool, char, long, ulong,string, DynamicData, byte[], short[], ushort[], int[], uint[], float[], double[], LongDouble[], bool[], char[], long[], ulong[].
member.remarks: The type of the value, `T`, must coincide with the declared type of the member. `T` is `string` for both regular IDL string and IDL wstring. If the member is an aggregation or a collection, `T` is . can be used to perform conversion from `T` to the declared type of the member.

member.name: M:Rti.Types.Dynamic.DynamicData.SetAnyValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a member value from any object
member.param: The name of the member to set
The value to set. This method will try to convert it to the type of the member

remarks.para: This method allows setting a member value without knowing the type of the value at compilation time. If the runtime type of `value` doesn't coincide with the type of the member type, this method uses System.Convert to attempt to convert it. If the conversion is not possible, any of the exceptions thrown by System.Convert may be thrown by this method as well.
This method provides great flexibility, but is less efficient than the concrete setters.
remarks.example:
The following example shows how to set an integer from a string:
sample.SetAnyValue("my_int", "45");

member.remarks: This function allows getting the value of member without knowing its type at compilation time. If the type is known, use the specific getter, such as GetValue<int> for ints.

member.summary: IDL 128-bit floating-point type.

remarks.para: This type is used by DDS to represent the IDL `long double` type and can be used among platforms for which there isn't a standard definition for a 128-bit floating-point type.

LongDouble can be converted to and from `decimal`, but this doesn't ensure interoperability with C, C++ or other applications for which a long double can have different representations. If a distributed system uses different long double representations, the applications are responsible for manually interpreting the individual bytes (provided as to ).
